ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Very writing definitely improved! It was an amazing course.
learned a lot about the how to master the art of writing in English

I had never taken a class about beauty before this course, so all of the readings we did were completely new to me. Overall, I learned much about how the perception of beauty has changed throughout past decades, how it has adapted to uniquely constrict women, and what conversations continue to be avoided especially in relation to beauty and race, sexuality, gender, etc.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class had no weaknesses. It was very engaging, and the professor conducted discussions well. It was a very organized course.
it was mainly focused on mastering the skill of writing. It was assumed that everyone knows the basics very well.

One of the strengths of this course was the order of the curriculum. During the latter units, I found it natural to reference the topics we had discussed in the first unit and the readings we had already done. One way the course stands to be improved is the implementation of tv and music video clips throughout each unit. In the second unit, we discussed "Pretty Hurts" by Beyonce, and one of the most interesting comparisons we made in the class, in my opinion, were comparing Beyonce's words (written for and from the perspective of a 2013 woman) to those of Naomi Wolf in "A Beauty Myth" (written for and from the perspective of a 1990's woman). More integration like this between the older books and poems we were reading in the later units and the music and media of modern-day culture should be added to the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This class is very interesting. I enjoyed all the readings. The readings were not overbearing and the homework load is very reasonable. The essays were enjoyable to write and the teacher gave great feedback. The professor was amazing..the best teacher I have ever had!

Absolutely loved this class, please take it. I found the topics ranging from beauty standards to plastic surgery all to be so interesting. Sophie is a great instructor and super understanding. For your first English course, I think its a great class to start with.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. I loved the structure of the course, it's instructor, and feel that the flexibility of the course have helped me improve as a writer this semester.
